snippet: The police fired tear gas and used water cannons to disperse crowds seeking to use the holiday to vent anger at the prime minister.
abstract: Police in Turkey fire tear gas and use water cannons to disperse hundreds of protesters seeking to challenge government ban on May Day celebrations in Taksim Square, also the scene of antigovernment protests against Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan in 2013; more than 140 people are detained and 90 people, including 19 police officers, are injured in clashes.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The police fired tear gas and used water cannons to disperse crowds seeking to use the holiday to vent anger at the prime minister.

headline.main: Turkish Protesters Defy Government’s May Day Ban
headline.print_headline: Turkish Protesters Defy Government’s May Day Ban
